org.apache.beam.it.splunk

Class SplunkResourceManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.beam.it.testcontainers.TestContainerResourceManager<SplunkContainer>
      • org.apache.beam.it.splunk.SplunkResourceManager
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    org.apache.beam.it.common.ResourceManager

    public class SplunkResourceManager
extends TestContainerResourceManager<SplunkContainer>
implements org.apache.beam.it.common.ResourceManager
    Client for managing Kafka resources.

    The class supports one Splunk server instance.

    The class is thread-safe.

    Note: The Splunk TestContainer will only run on M1 Mac's if the Docker version is >= 4.16.0 and the "Use Rosetta for x86/amd64 emulation on Apple Silicon" setting is enabled.

    • Method Detail

      • builder

        public static SplunkResourceManager.Builder builder(java.lang.String testId)

      • getHttpEndpoint

        public java.lang.String getHttpEndpoint()
        Returns the HTTP endpoint that this Splunk server is configured to listen on.
        Returns:
        the HTTP endpoint.

      • getHecEndpoint

        public java.lang.String getHecEndpoint()
        Returns the HTTP Event Collector (HEC) endpoint that this Splunk server is configured to receive events at.

        This will be the HTTP endpoint concatenated with '/services/collector/event'.

        Returns:
        the HEC service endpoint.

      • getHecToken

        public java.lang.String getHecToken()
        Returns the Splunk Http Event Collector (HEC) authentication token used to connect to this Splunk instance's HEC service.
        Returns:
        the HEC authentication token.

      • sendHttpEvent

        public boolean sendHttpEvent(SplunkEvent event)
        Sends the given HTTP event to the Splunk Http Event Collector (HEC) service.

        Note: Setting the index field in the Splunk event requires the index already being configured in the Splunk instance. Unless using a static Splunk instance, omit this field from the event.

        Parameters:
        event - The SpunkEvent to send to the HEC service.
        Returns:
        True, if the request was successful.

      • sendHttpEvents

        public boolean sendHttpEvents(java.util.Collection<SplunkEvent> events)
        Sends the given HTTP events to the Splunk Http Event Collector (HEC) service.

        Note: Setting the index field in the Splunk event requires the index already being configured in the Splunk instance. Unless using a static Splunk instance, omit this field from the events.

        Parameters:
        events - The SpunkEvents to send to the HEC service.
        Returns:
        True, if the request was successful.

      • getEvents

        public java.util.List<SplunkEvent> getEvents()
        Return a list of all Splunk events retrieved from the Splunk server.
        Returns:
        All Splunk events on the server.

      • getEvents

        public java.util.List<SplunkEvent> getEvents(java.lang.String query)
        Return a list of Splunk events retrieved from the Splunk server based on the given query.

        e.g. query: 'search source=mySource sourcetype=mySourceType host=myHost'

        Parameters:
        query - The query to filter events by.
        Returns:
        All Splunk events on the server that match the given query.
